key_points: The ninth meeting of the WHO Emergency Committee on COVID-19 occurred on 22 October 2021.
The meeting focused on the ongoing challenges of the pandemic and emphasized a risk-based vaccination approach.
Committee members were briefed on ethics and conflict of interest.
Global epidemiological updates and vaccine equity issues were discussed.
Concerns were raised about the African Region's access to vaccines, diagnostics, and therapeutics.
The importance of maintaining public health and social measures (PHSM) alongside vaccinations was underlined.
Research needs on various aspects of SARS-CoV-2 and pandemic response were identified.
The pandemic is considered far from over, with a need for continued use of all available tools to control it.
The COVID-19 pandemic still constitutes a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
The Director-General agreed with the Committee's advice and issued Temporary Recommendations to States Parties.
